summary: Allows editing, saving, and compiling of Papyrus scripts from your favorite text editor even if opened through Mod Organizer or Creation Kit run through Mod Organizer
descriptionHtml:
This project provides a fix that allows for editing and compiling [url=http://www.creationkit.com/Category:Papyrus]Papyrus scripts[/url]in an external editor that has been invoked through Creation Kit while opened through [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1334/]Mod Organizer[/url].
How do I get set up?[list][*][url=https://bitbucket.org/Triquetra/mo-ck-scriptfix/downloads]Download[/url] the latest version of MOCKfix[/*]
[*][url=http://www.7-zip.org/]Extract[/url] the contents of the archive to a directory of your choice (e.g. C:\Program Files (x86)\MOCKfix)[/*]
[*]Set MOCKfix.exe as your default application for opening .psc files[/*]
[*]Set the directory for Mod Organizer and the path and executable for your editor of choice in the MOCKfix.ini (which needs to be located in
your Documents directory -- a sample is provided in the download archive)[/*]
[*]Select edit with external editor in Creation Kit or "Open" a script source file in Mod Organizer
[/*]
[*]To properly compile a papyrus script, you will need toÂ [url=http://www.creationkit.com/Category:Text_Editors]set up your editor[/url] and include an editor specific build script: [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/1855355-creation-kit-with-mod-organizer/?p=16182390]Notepad++[/url], [url=https://github.com/Triquetra/SublimePapyrus]Sublime Text[/url][/*]
[/list]
author: Thalioden
